abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Additional
            Financing for the Second Health Sector Development Project
            (HSDP II) for Tanzania is to assist the Borrower in
            continuing to improve the quality of health services and
            management of resources allocated to the health sector
            through the expansion of the health sector policy and
            institutional capacity building reforms initiated during the
            first phase of the program. The Second Health Sector
            Strategic Plan (HSSP II) was launched in 2003 and was
            supported by over 20 development partners through a mix of
            general budget support, the Health Basket Fund (HBF), and
            targeted project financing (largely for malaria and AIDS).
            The additional financing will fund scaled-up activities to
            enhance the impact of this well-performing project,
            specifically covering costs associated with the initial two
            years of Third Health Sector Strategic Plan (HSSP III). The
            project has contributed to the Government of Tanzania's
            long term health sector program. This program has included
            efforts to increase financing for district-level essential
            health services; scale-up the integrated management of
            childhood illness; increase vitamin A distribution; improve
            malaria treatment and HIV/AIDS testing, counseling and
            treatment; implement strategies for reducing maternal
            mortality; expand public-private partnerships for access to
            medicines; distribute bed nets; provide services by
            faith-based institutions; strengthen routine monitoring and
            evaluation (M&E); expand insurance coverage; and
            rehabilitate primary health facilities.
